basics.name: Ivan Voskoboinyk
basics.label: Senior React.js / Full Stack Web Developer

work.name: Prezly
work.position: Full-Stack Web Developer / Backend Team Lead Developer
work.summary: Got an amazing opportunity to join a Belgian startup team of 3 people (founders) in 2015. Got priceless experience growing professionally as the company was growing. Now Prezly is a team of 20 people and a few millions annual recurring revenue.
highlights: Picked up a legacy Symfony1 application codebase to modernize, refactor and improve it.
Pulled Laravel Service Container with dependencies auto-wiring into the project.
Pulled Laravel Job Queue & workers into the project to modernize existing background jobs processing architecture.
Introduced React/Redux stack to power application customer-facing UI.
Learned how to use Docker, AWS services; got core knowledge of Kubernetes cloud infrastructure.
Was the main responsible person for designing and documenting internal REST APIs and then opening them to customers.
Got great experience on project management and leadership, being a lead developer of a mixed backend/frontend team, lead backend team developer.
Implemented an internal integration tests framework to simplify writing integration tests, which significantly increased code coverage for all important parts of the app.

work.name: Ansata Web Group
work.summary: Worked in a team varying from two to three developers, learning from more experienced colleagues on outsourced e-Commerce websites for B2B apparel companies in US & Canada. Responsibilities included analysis of customer requirements, implementing UI layouts & business logic.
highlights: Got solid knowledge of the Symfony framework and .
Implemented and open-sourced a number of Symfony1 plugins.
Extended Sir Trevor JS (an open-source structured-content editor) to add columns layout functionality.

Initiated & implemented a number of improvements to the development workflows, including switching from SVN to GIT, introducing a PM tool for task tracking, improving frontend dev experience by introducing LESS and SCSS.

work.name: Freelance
work.summary: Switched back web development to further improve my skills and knowledge of the to the internet/web ecosystem.
highlights: Implemented a homebrew customizable CMS based on EAV data model to power the websites.
Learned web accessibility best practices.
Switched to Ubuntu Linux as main development environment, mastered Bash one-liners for day-to-day tasks.

Implemented a math notebook client-server application as a hobby project to help with calculations for my Master's Thesis research project. Similar to Jupyter Notebook, but based on PHP + Doctrine ORM in backend, and jQuery + LaTeX formulas for frontend.
